CVE-2016-6207.title: USN-3060-1: GD library vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-6207.body: It was discovered that the GD library incorrectly handled memory when using gdImageScale(). A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or possibly execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2016-6207)

CVE-2016-6214.title: USN-3060-1: GD library vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-6214.body: It was discovered that the GD library incorrectly handled certain malformed TGA images. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted TGA image, an attacker could cause a denial of service. (CVE-2016-6132, CVE-2016-6214)

CVE-2016-6224.title: USN-3032-1: eCryptfs vulnerability
CVE-2016-6224.body: It was discovered that eCryptfs incorrectly configured the encrypted swap partition for certain drive types. An attacker could use this issue to discover sensitive information.

CVE-2016-6232.title: USN-3042-1: KDE-Libs vulnerability
CVE-2016-6232.body: Andreas Cord-Landwehr discovered that KDE-Libs incorrectly handled extracting certain archives. If a user were tricked into extracting a specially-crafted archive, a remote attacker could use this issue to overwrite arbitrary files out of the extraction directory.

CVE-2016-6261.title: USN-3068-1: Libidn vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-6261.body: Hanno Böck discovered that Libidn incorrectly handled certain input. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Libidn to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-8948, CVE-2016-6262, CVE-2016-6261, CVE-2016-6263)

CVE-2016-6262.title: USN-3068-1: Libidn vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-6262.body: Hanno Böck discovered that Libidn incorrectly handled certain input. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Libidn to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-8948, CVE-2016-6262, CVE-2016-6261, CVE-2016-6263)

CVE-2016-6263.title: USN-3068-1: Libidn vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-6263.body: Hanno Böck discovered that Libidn incorrectly handled certain input. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause Libidn to crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2015-8948, CVE-2016-6262, CVE-2016-6261, CVE-2016-6263)

CVE-2016-6296.title: USN-3059-1: xmlrpc-epi vulnerability
CVE-2016-6296.body: It was discovered that xmlrpc-epi incorrectly handled lengths in the simplestring_addn function. A remote attacker could use this issue to cause applications using xmlrpc-epi such as PHP to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2016-6313.title: USN-3065-1: Libgcrypt vulnerability
CVE-2016-6313.body: Felix Dörre and Vladimir Klebanov discovered that Libgcrypt incorrectly handled mixing functions in the random number generator. An attacker able to obtain 4640 bits from the RNG can trivially predict the next 160 bits of output.

CVE-2016-6313.title: USN-3064-1: GnuPG vulnerability
CVE-2016-6313.body: Felix Dörre and Vladimir Klebanov discovered that GnuPG incorrectly handled mixing functions in the random number generator. An attacker able to obtain 4640 bits from the RNG can trivially predict the next 160 bits of output.

CVE-2016-6321.title: USN-3132-1: tar vulnerability
CVE-2016-6321.body: Harry Sintonen discovered that tar incorrectly handled extracting files when path names are specified on the command line. If a user or automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted archive, an attacker could possibly overwrite arbitrary files.

CVE-2016-6352.title: USN-3085-1: GDK-PixBuf vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-6352.body: Franco Costantini discovered that the GDK-PixBuf library contained an out-of-bounds write error when parsing an ico file. If a user or automated system were tricked into opening a crafted ico file, a remote attacker could use this flaw to cause GDK-PixBuf to crash, resulting in a denial of service. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2016-6352)

CVE-2016-6855.title: USN-3069-1: Eye of GNOME vulnerability
CVE-2016-6855.body: It was discovered that Eye of GNOME incorrectly handled certain invalid UTF-8 strings. If a user were tricked into opening a specially-crafted image, a remote attacker could use this issue to cause Eye of GNOME to crash, resulting in a denial of service, or possibly execute arbitrary code.

CVE-2016-7044.title: USN-3086-1: Irssi vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-7044.body: Gabriel Campana and Adrien Guinet discovered that the format parsing code in Irssi did not properly verify 24bit color codes. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash). (CVE-2016-7044)

CVE-2016-7045.title: USN-3086-1: Irssi vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-7045.body: Gabriel Campana and Adrien Guinet discovered that a buffer overflow existed in the format parsing code in Irssi. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (application crash). (CVE-2016-7045)

CVE-2016-7146.title: USN-3137-1: MoinMoin vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-7146.body: It was discovered that MoinMoin did not properly sanitize certain inputs, resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing server output during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain.

CVE-2016-7148.title: USN-3137-1: MoinMoin vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-7148.body: It was discovered that MoinMoin did not properly sanitize certain inputs, resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing server output during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain.

CVE-2016-7162.title: USN-3074-1: File Roller vulnerability
CVE-2016-7162.body: It was discovered that File Roller incorrectly handled symlinks. If a user were tricked into extracting a specially-crafted archive, an attacker could delete files outside of the extraction directory.

CVE-2016-7425.title: USN-3147-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-7425.body: Marco Grassi discovered that the driver for Areca RAID Controllers in the Linux kernel did not properly validate control messages. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gain privileges. (CVE-2016-7425)

CVE-2016-7795.title: USN-3094-1: Systemd vulnerability
CVE-2016-7795.body: Andrew Ayer discovered that Systemd improperly handled zero-length notification messages. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (init crash leading to system unavailability).

CVE-2016-8655.title: USN-3152-2: Linux kernel (Raspberry Pi 2) vulnerability
CVE-2016-8655.body: Philip Pettersson discovered a race condition in the af_packet implementation in the Linux kernel. A local unprivileged attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or run arbitrary code with administrative privileges.

CVE-2016-8658.title: USN-3146-2: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-8658.body: Daxing Guo discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in the Broadcom IEEE802.11n FullMAC driver in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly gain privileges. (CVE-2016-8658)

CVE-2016-9014.title: USN-3115-1: Django vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-9014.body: Aymeric Augustin discovered that Django incorrectly validated hosts when being run with the debug setting enabled. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to perform DNS rebinding attacks. (CVE-2016-9014)

CVE-2016-9119.title: USN-3137-1: MoinMoin vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-9119.body: It was discovered that MoinMoin did not properly sanitize certain inputs, resulting in cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities. With cross-site scripting vulnerabilities, if a user were tricked into viewing server output during a crafted server request, a remote attacker could exploit this to modify the contents, or steal confidential data, within the same domain.

CVE-2016-9243.title: USN-3138-1: python-cryptography vulnerability
CVE-2016-9243.body: Markus Döring discovered that python-cryptography incorrectly handled certain HKDF lengths. This could result in python-cryptography returning an empty string instead of the expected derived key.

CVE-2016-9644.title: USN-3146-2: Linux kernel (Xenial HWE) vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-9644.body: It was discovered that the __get_user_asm_ex implementation in the Linux kernel for x86/x86_64 contained extended asm statements that were incompatible with the exception table. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2016-9644)

CVE-2016-9644.title: USN-3146-1: Linux kernel vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-9644.body: It was discovered that the __get_user_asm_ex implementation in the Linux kernel for x86/x86_64 contained extended asm statements that were incompatible with the exception table. A local attacker could use this to gain administrative privileges. (CVE-2016-9644)

CVE-2016-9775.title: USN-3177-2: Tomcat regression
CVE-2016-9775.body: Paul Szabo discovered that the Tomcat package incorrectly handled upgrades and removals. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain root privileges. (CVE-2016-9774, CVE-2016-9775)

CVE-2016-9775.title: USN-3177-1: Tomcat vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-9775.body: Paul Szabo discovered that the Tomcat package incorrectly handled upgrades and removals. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain root privileges. (CVE-2016-9774, CVE-2016-9775)

CVE-2016-9949.title: USN-3157-1: Apport vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-9949.body: Donncha O Cearbhaill discovered that the crash file parser in Apport improperly treated the CrashDB field as python code. An attacker could use this to convince a user to open a maliciously crafted crash file and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of that user. This issue only affected Ubuntu 14.04 LTS and Ubuntu 16.04 LTS. (CVE-2016-9949)

CVE-2016-9950.title: USN-3157-1: Apport vulnerabilities
CVE-2016-9950.body: Donncha O Cearbhaill discovered that Apport did not properly sanitize the Package and SourcePackage fields in crash files before processing package specific hooks. An attacker could use this to convince a user to open a maliciously crafted crash file and execute arbitrary code with the privileges of that user. (CVE-2016-9950)
